column2: and his voice was soft as he answered
column3: 'No need is there to take the gold combs from thy hair or to change thy white robe for one less fair. This is thy wedding-day
column4: and I have come to claim my bride.' And King Horn flung aside the old torn coat
column5: and the Princess Jean saw that beneath the rags Hynde Horn was clothed as one of kingly rank.Then throughout the palace the tidings spread
column8: and now is he king of his own country.'And that very day King Horn was wedded to the beautiful Princess Jean
column10: and amid the rejoicings of the people.And Prince Fykenyld slunk away
column11: ashamed to look his old playmate in the face.Not many months passed ere King Horn and Queen Jean sailed away to reign together in the far East. And never again in the years to come did the diamonds on King Horn's ring grow dull or dim.
